title: Alexander Špoljarić
text:
Alexander Špoljarić (<a href="Greek%20language">Greek</a>: Αλεξάντερ Σπόλιαριτς, ; born 28 November 1995) is a Serbian <a href="Cyprus">Cypriot</a> <a href="Association%20football">football</a> <a href="Goalkeeper%20%28association%20football%29">goalkeeper</a>, who plays for <a href="Nea%20Salamis%20Famagusta%20FC">Nea Salamis Famagusta FC</a>.
Club career.
Born in <a href="Limassol">Limassol</a>, he started playing football in Campus Sportivo Football Academy when he was 4 years old. After completing seven years at the academy, he trained with his father's academy for 1 year as a goalkeeper. Later he was with <a href="Aris%20Limassol%20FC">Aris Limassol</a> academy until he was 17. Finally, he moved to <a href="Enosis%20Neon%20Parekklisia%20F.C.">Enosis Neon Parekklisia</a>, which also became his first team after his youth career ended. In summer 2014, he joined <a href="OFK%20Beograd">OFK Beograd</a>, where he made his professional debut in the last fixture of the <a href="2014%E2%80%9315%20Serbian%20SuperLiga">2014–15 Serbian SuperLiga</a> season, against <a href="FK%20Jagodina">Jagodina</a>. At the beginning of 2017, Špoljarić moved to <a href="Belgrade%20Zone%20League">Belgrade Zone League</a> side <a href="FK%20Hajduk%20Beograd">Hajduk Beograd</a> on six-month loan. In summer 2017, he moved to <a href="FK%20Grafi%C4%8Dar%20Beograd">Grafičar Beograd</a> as a single player.
Ahead of the 2019-20 season, Špoljarić joined <a href="Alki%20Oroklini">Alki Oroklini</a>. He then moved to <a href="Othellos%20Athienou%20FC">Othellos Athienou</a> for the 2020-21 season. In the summer 2021, he moved to <a href="Nea%20Salamis%20Famagusta%20FC">Nea Salamis Famagusta FC</a>.
Personal life.
Alexander's father is <a href="Milenko%20%C5%A0poljari%C4%87">Milenko Špoljarić</a>, who was also a footballer; he is the older brother of <a href="Matija%20%C5%A0poljari%C4%87">Matija</a> and <a href="Danilo%20%C5%A0poljari%C4%87">Danilo Špoljarić</a>.
